intro: Antidesma collettii, commonly known as the Madagascar antidesma, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
